title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.19 Part 3 | 17-08-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: The learned Brahmana said, O son of Pritha, this child shall be exactly like King Ikshvaku, son of Manu, in maintaining all those who are born.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces and explains the 19th verse of the 12th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, focusing on the comparison of the child to King Ikshvaku and Lord Rama.

segments.key_quote: So the teaching of Bhagavad Gita is coming down in parampara, in disciplic succession, in the parampara of Rajarshis, the saintly kings.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the role of saintly kings in protecting all living beings and discusses the parampara (disciplic succession) through which the knowledge of Bhagavad Gita was transmitted, starting from Krishna to Vivasvan, Manu, and Ikshwaku.

segments.key_quote: All the Vedic literatures are current from the very beginning of creation of the material world.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the breaking of the Rajarshi parampara, the eternal nature of Vedic literatures, and further details about Maharaj Ikshwaku, including his lineage and his prohibition of meat-eating.

segments.key_quote: Maintaining those who are born, the king is able, capable, it's possible for him to maintain all those who are born in a particular land in his kingdom, if he is receiving the knowledge in the parampara, and he is a strict follower of those principles.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that Pariksit will be like Ikshwaku in maintaining everyone and highlights the importance of a king receiving knowledge in parampara and possessing specific qualifications to be a proper protector.

segments.key_quote: This Vaivasvata Manu is receiving the knowledge of Bhagavad Gita from his father from his father Vivasvan to whom Krishna spoke Bhagavad Gita millions of years back.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates the lineage of Vaivasvata Manu and his reception of Bhagavad Gita knowledge, then briefly touches upon the beginning of creation and the population of the universe.

segments.key_quote: Pariksit will be like Ikshwaku in maintaining everyone perfectly.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the Matsya Avatar's appearance during Vaivasvata Manu's reign, the principles of Bhakti Yoga taught to Manu, and how Ikshwaku ruled perfectly, emphasizing that Pariksit will emulate Ikshwaku in providing perfect protection.

segments.key_quote: Lord Rama appeared as the son of his pure devotee.
segments.summary: The speaker transitions to the comparison with Lord Rama, highlighting his adherence to Brahmanical principles and truthfulness, and describes Rama's appearance as an incarnation of the Supreme Lord with his plenary portions.

segments.key_quote: Rama was known for giving perfect protection to all the people of Prajna.
segments.summary: The speaker recounts Lord Rama's acts of protecting sages and killing demons, emphasizing his role in providing perfect protection, and reiterates that Pariksit will also offer similar protection before concluding the session.
